Anyone else getting BSOD? The third time I got the black screen of death and I'm currently re-installing Windows 7.  I got the black screen after installing visual studio 2010 and before installing VS 2010 I got two blue screen of death.

By the way if you are installing this you might want to back up your files asap.  I'm only using this computer to game and now I have reinstall 40 GB of games.

To set up a restore point go to control panel and click system and security. Click on the Systems link and on the top left side bar click system protection.  Under the system protection tab click the Create button and name your restore point to the current day, month and year.  This will save you a lot of time and trouble if you do anything stupid like me.

To those who have problem with booting this on USB. 
1. Go to google, search for "PLoP". Download it, follow the instructions.

2. You will burn PLoP on a CD. 

3. You put the downloaded Windows 7 files to your USB.

4. You restart your PC, go to BIOS and make sure you select the option where the system will boot from the CD

5. Restart PC again, after some seconds, your PC will boot the PLoP CD that you burned. 

6. The PLoP program starts, it will show different options such as "Boot from USB" Boot from Floppy" and so on, of course you choose "Boot from USB". 

7. Now your Windows 7 installation starts. Later you kick some ass, good luck!

@ divitedsouza 
I have used this windows 7, also have used the windows loader 2.1.4 by Daz (it's in Maherz's torrents) and I've had no problems yet. I downloaded all updates from Windows Update including the ones for genuine activation and it says it's genuine. Checked on the Microsoft site itself. So I doubt there's a reason to worry.
If you're still paranoid about it, you have to avoid the update number KB971033. You can always remove it if you want, Google has many articles on it.
Hope that helped.
